issue.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons â€” share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances â€” pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Coverage of major social medias' Tor addresses had not been universally applied in Base Filter and Popups Filter, primarily in the case of Reddit whose Tor address is the newest created.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

1. Your comment

Although the `[$` syntax was new to me, I went through the 3 most important files in the repo to modify their existing entries to cover the Tor addresses.

2. Screenshots

<details><summary>Reddit Onion site ad currently not blocked by big adblocker lists:</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22780683/221485786-ea2f8d57-7464-4662-8628-3dd414901c9f.png)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

The only consistent problem I have with AdGuard on Safari is with CNN, especially CNN videos. When I watch a video on CNN using Safari, 75% of the time, an ad will play prior to the video. And because I hate ads, I don't watch the video. This does not happen when watching CNN videos using Chrome. No ads. Obviously, the easy fix is to only use Chrome when on the CNN website, but there are advantages to using Safari on almost every other site, as I'm a Mac user. Thanks for making a great product that allows me to navigate the internet without all the garbage. ### Screenshots

commits.message: Added coverage for the Tor domains of Reddit, Twitter, and Facebook (#144136)

pull_request.title: Added coverage for the Tor domains of Reddit, Twitter, and Facebook
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [ ] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons â€” share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances â€” pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Coverage of major social medias' Tor addresses had not been universally applied in Base Filter and Popups Filter, primarily in the case of Reddit whose Tor address is the newest created.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

1. Your comment

Although the `[$` syntax was new to me, I went through the 3 most important files in the repo to modify their existing entries to cover the Tor addresses.

2. Screenshots

<details><summary>Reddit Onion site ad currently not blocked by big adblocker lists:</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22780683/221485786-ea2f8d57-7464-4662-8628-3dd414901c9f.png)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons â€” share, like, tweet, etc;
- [x] Annoyances â€” pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Coverage of major social medias' Tor addresses had not been universally applied in Base Filter and Popups Filter, primarily in the case of Reddit whose Tor address is the newest created.

### Enter the issue address

N/A

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

1. Your comment

Although the `[$` syntax was new to me, I went through the 3 most important files in the repo to modify their existing entries to cover the Tor addresses.

2. Screenshots

<details><summary>Reddit Onion site ad currently not blocked by big adblocker lists:</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22780683/221485786-ea2f8d57-7464-4662-8628-3dd414901c9f.png)

</details>

issue.title: Cado Labs researchers recently discovered a novel cryptojacking campaign targeting insecure deployments of Redis
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

There was a recent discovery into a new cryptojacking campaign by Cado Labs which identifies a range of new mining pools to add to the AdGuard Base filter cryptominers filter.

A custom XMRig configuration is written to disk, which registers the miner with the following mining pools:

xmr.pool.gntl.co.uk
pool.hashvault.pro
xmr-eu1.nanopool.org
monerohash.com
pool.supportxmr.com
ca.monero.herominers.com
xmrpool.eu
pool.xmrfast.com
pool.xmr.pt


### Proposed solution

Block the above in the AdGuard Base cryptominers filter.

### Additional information

https://www.cadosecurity.com/redis-miner-leverages-command-line-file-hosting-service/

comment.body:
The article under additional information explains it.

In short, those are the mining pools used by the exploit which are written to a config after the vulnerable Redis district is prepared.

issue.title: Cado Labs researchers recently discovered a novel cryptojacking campaign targeting insecure deployments of Redis
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

There was a recent discovery into a new cryptojacking campaign by Cado Labs which identifies a range of new mining pools to add to the AdGuard Base filter cryptominers filter.

A custom XMRig configuration is written to disk, which registers the miner with the following mining pools:

xmr.pool.gntl.co.uk
pool.hashvault.pro
xmr-eu1.nanopool.org
monerohash.com
pool.supportxmr.com
ca.monero.herominers.com
xmrpool.eu
pool.xmrfast.com
pool.xmr.pt


### Proposed solution

Block the above in the AdGuard Base cryptominers filter.

### Additional information

https://www.cadosecurity.com/redis-miner-leverages-command-line-file-hosting-service/

comment.body: Why mining pools must be blocked?

issue.title: Threema Web and App (all messengers)
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Since an update from Adguard, Threema Web or the app no longer runs on a Windows computer. Even if I deactivate Adguard. I have to take the DNS in the Fritzbox away from Adguard, delete the DNS cache on the Windows machine and restart. Then Threema gets a connection again.

### Proposed solution

I have not yet been able to narrow down the problem.
In general, I would find it helpful if messengers were excluded from Adguard when filtering.

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body: I need step-by-step instruction. I never used this app.

issue.title: Cado Labs researchers recently discovered a novel cryptojacking campaign targeting insecure deployments of Redis
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

There was a recent discovery into a new cryptojacking campaign by Cado Labs which identifies a range of new mining pools to add to the AdGuard Base filter cryptominers filter.

A custom XMRig configuration is written to disk, which registers the miner with the following mining pools:

xmr.pool.gntl.co.uk
pool.hashvault.pro
xmr-eu1.nanopool.org
monerohash.com
pool.supportxmr.com
ca.monero.herominers.com
xmrpool.eu
pool.xmrfast.com
pool.xmr.pt


### Proposed solution

Block the above in the AdGuard Base cryptominers filter.

### Additional information

https://www.cadosecurity.com/redis-miner-leverages-command-line-file-hosting-service/

issue.title: Check if these rules are really needed
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

4.1.53

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances â€” pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

NA

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

I don't remove a rule of `||a.com^` when EL has `||a.com^$third-party` as advised, but I think whether these rules are really needed should be checked. Here the list of such rules:
```
! firstparty
||ads.linkedin.com^
! adservers
||histock.info^
||admanmedia.com^
||adsrv4k.com^
||fireworkadservices1.com^
||getmyfreetraffic.com^
||paibopse.com^
||reevaipi.com^
||sendmepush.com^
||profield.ddns.net^
```

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.sportsplays.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.sportsplays.com%2F) ### Comment > I use sanitize, adblocker, together with adguard, .. it used to work fine before even with these extentions, and now disabled them. and use just adguard adblocker from ios. > This site uses a lot of watching video ads, before going to the next web page, perhaps by mgids or mgads, but adguard does block them from happening. I have been using adguard for more than at least 9 years or more. > and never have issues with it. > I always have in mind of buying adguard premium, but are afraid of these adblocker being detected. > My favorite feature of adguard is is the custom user rule, that I can add, but lately it is not functioning as before. > > I believe they just updated their rules by detecting adblockers with adguard. > Besides they updated completely to a newer website. > Meaning sanitize and adblocker is not the culprit here. .. > > All I have to disable is the General rule in adguard and it stops, the adblocker detected page of sportsplays.com, see photos, please. > the rest work fine like eliminating ads and video ads, ads comments by this website > Sorry for the long description explanations I hope it helps understanding the problem better. > > I like to use a lot of cosmetic filtering useless item on a webpage, like social media buttons comments and sports betting ads and recomendations. > The other website I use a lot is www.covers.com, but unable to block sports betting ads and recomendations. > Can you please check it out too, or do you need a separate report inquiry on this website? > Thank you for your attentions. Take care all the best. KenMitch ### Screenshots

### Issue URL (Ads) [https://kaktus.kg/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fkaktus.kg%2F) ### Comment Username: @DandelionSprout > What appears to be ads or sponsored articles ("Ð‘Ð¸Ð·Ð½ÐµÑ Ð¶Ð°Ò£Ñ‹Ð»Ñ‹ÐºÑ‚Ð°Ñ€"), both on the frontpage and below articles. I propose: > ``` > ! https://kaktus.kg/ > kaktus.kg,kaktus.media##.Dashboard--CompanyArticles > ! https://kaktus.kg/doc/10585_koomdyk_transportko_bolgon_jol_kirenin_baasy_etap_etaby_menen_kotorylot._birok_azyr_emes.html > kaktus.kg,kaktus.media##.Article--ad > ``` > The specific domain (`kaktus.kg`) could be considered to be exclusively in Kyrgyz for the purposes of https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/144318#issuecomment-1452035235, although it has a sister site called `kaktus.media` in Russian with the same ad positioning ("ÐÐ¾Ð²Ð¾ÑÑ‚Ð¸ ÐºÐ¾Ð¼Ð¿Ð°Ð½Ð¸Ð¹"). ### Screenshots
